param.name: input_raster
param.dialogReference: Input magnetic or gravity raster dataset for analytic signal calculation.

param.name: buffer_size
param.dialogReference: Buffer zone size for edge effect reduction during derivative calculations.

tool.summary: Calculate analytic signal amplitude for source location and edge detection
tool.usage:
The analytic signal amplitude is calculated as sqrt(dx² + dy² + dz²) where dx, dy, dz are the first derivatives in x, y, and z directions. This transformation produces anomalies that are symmetric and directly over their causative sources.

Advantages:

• Independent of magnetic field direction

• Independent of source magnetization direction

• Peaks directly over source edges and contacts

• Always positive values

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The analytic signal amplitude transforms geophysical data to locate sources and edges independent of magnetic field direction and source magnetization. Results are always positive.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Source location, edge detection, and structural interpretation in magnetic and gravity surveys.
dataIdInfo.useLimit: Works best with magnetic data but can be applied to gravity data. May amplify noise - consider filtering input data first. Results are always positive values.
